thread.title: EastEnders director denies Sharon Mitchell character has been replaced after fans say she sounds different on the phone
thread.title_full: EastEnders director denies Sharon Mitchell character has been replaced after fans say she sounds different on the phone

author: Mirror .co.uk
title: EastEnders director denies Sharon Mitchell character has been replaced after fans say she sounds different on the phone
text:
EastEnders director denies Sharon Mitchell character has been replaced after fans say she sounds different on the phone "That sounded nothing like Sharon," one soap fan wrote following the scene Share EastEnders boss: It WAS Sharon (Photo: BBC)   
An EastEnders director has responded to viewers who assumed Sharon Mitchell's character had been replaced. 
On Tuesday night's episode, viewers watched Michelle speak on the phone to Sharon - who wasn't pictured because she's currently on a holiday with hubby Phil. 
After their conversation, fans flocked to Twitter to point out she didn't sound anything like she usually does. 
" #eastenders that sounded nothing like Sharon," one wrote. Michelle talks to Sharon (Photo: BBC) 
While another shared: "That was not Sharon's voice on the phone. Dennis has a secret mother." 
A third wrote: "What DEMON did they get to do Sharon's voiceover?" 
After catching wind of the comments, the soap's director Kate Saxon took to Twitter to clear up any confusion. 
"It is Sharon Mitchell/ Letitia Dean on the phone," she wrote before adding, "I directed the episode - including her recording." 
Kate then explained why she decided to include Sharon actress Letitia Dean's voice. 
"I prefer doing so, as when I'm in a room with someone else on their mobile, I can generally hear the other end of the call." 
And Letitia was included in the episode's credits as was Kellie Bright who was also heard but not seen during a phone call.
